Science

Department

Chemistry

Program at a Glance

Delve into Chemistry and work with faculty mentors and state-of-the-art instrumentation to develop theoretical knowledge and practical skills. You can tailor your education to your goals with a flexible curriculum of seminars, research opportunities, and multiple degree options and specializations. Our programs are rigorous, supportive, and designed to the standards of the American Chemical Society to build a strong foundation for pursuing your career or graduate study.

Chemistry Minor

You’ll benefit from:

  • Expert faculty leading an American Chemical Society-approved program
  • Dedicated support and student-centered classes to help you succeed
  • A flexible curriculum with your choice of specializations, concentrations, or tracks
  • State-of-the-art technology, facilities, and specialized software
  • The option to complete a  secondary education degree in 4 years
  • Nearly 100% placement for job seekers within 6 months of graduation
  • High acceptance for PhD, medical/osteopathic, dental, pharmacy, and law programs
  • Opportunities for faculty-mentored research, internships, and student groups
  • Deep preparation for career-readiness or entry into graduate programs
  • Strong faculty advising and access to TCNJ’s deep industry alumni network
  • Regional chemical companies looking for applicants with chemistry degrees
  • Guidance on a premedical path from the Medical Careers Advisory Committee

Careers

As a Chemistry major, you can choose to enter the chemical profession, pursue graduate work,  launch a career in chemical education, or prepare for advanced studies. TCNJ is located in the middle of “Pharmaceutical Alley” and home to many potential employers, including flavor and fragrance manufacturers, cosmetic companies, materials manufacturers, and chemical/environmental testing companies. Nearly 100% of TCNJ Chemistry graduates seeking jobs in industry find one within 6 months.

The vast majority of recent graduates have chosen to enter professional schools (Medicine, Dentistry, Optometry, or Podiatry), landing in top institutions.

Recent Employers

Why Study Chemistry at TCNJ?

Our students learn the art and science of Chemistry in an environment of high expectations and strong personal support. Our faculty members are teacher-scholars. Not only do they teach chemistry, they practice chemistry, publishing their research in national and international peer-reviewed journals. Furthermore, they pursue this research with you! More than 80% of our students engage in undergraduate research under the mentorship of a faculty member. Combine this with state-of-the-art teaching laboratories and exceptional scientific instrumentation and you have a recipe for successful careers in science, industry, the health professions, and education.

American Chemical Society (ACS) Certification

The Department of Chemistry offers American Chemical Society (ACS) certified and non-ACS certified BS degrees, both of which require a rigorous program in each of the five subdivisions of chemistry as well as physics and math.  Students entering TCNJ as chemistry majors are initially enrolled in the ACS-certified BS program. They may transfer to the non-ACS program after faculty advisement and department approval based on student interests.

Experiential Learning

The Department strongly encourages you to engage in independent research during the academic year through independent study courses (CHE 493) and during the summer through the Mentored Undergraduate Summer Experiences Program (MUSE). Students can participate in research programs with faculty members in each sub-discipline of chemistry in well-equipped research laboratories.  Some projects have multidisciplinary aspects and involve collaborations within and outside the department.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

One of the biggest advantages to studying chemistry at TCNJ is the access you’ll have to facilities, starting day one. Our faculty teach and work in state-of-the-art labs, where they train students to be independent scholars. TCNJ chemistry students get hands-on access to that same exceptional instrumentation in their classes and research.

Faculty

Consistent with the goals of TCNJ, the Chemistry faculty has substantial contact with each student. Faculty advisors meet regularly with students to assist in defining educational paths that will best allow the pursuit of career goals. Assistance is also provided through a comprehensive seminar program spanning 3 of the standard four-year curriculum that incorporates discussions of the roles and responsibilities of chemists in today’s society and introduces students to “the tools of the trade.”
